Class ConsoleMenu

java.lang.Object
ConsoleMenu
public class ConsoleMenu extends Object
Handles the console-based user interface for the item management system. It displays an interactive menu, processes user input for navigation and option selection, and uses ANSI escape codes for styling the output.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleMenu

      public ConsoleMenu()

  • Method Details

    • clearScreen

      public void clearScreen()
      Clears the console screen using ANSI escape codes. It moves the cursor to the home position (top-left) and clears the screen.

    • pause

      public void pause() throws IOException
      Pauses the execution and waits for the user to press ENTER to continue. After the user presses ENTER, the screen is cleared.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • printMenu

      public void printMenu()
      Prints the main menu to the console. It displays a title and lists all available options, highlighting the currently selected one.

    • cleanBuffer

      public void cleanBuffer() throws IOException
      Clears any leftover characters from the input buffer (System.in). This is typically used after reading specific input to prevent interference with subsequent reads.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from the input stream.

    • start

      public void start()
      Initializes the console menu display by hiding the cursor.

    • close

      public void close()
      Performs cleanup operations before exiting the application. This includes showing the cursor, closing the scanner, and terminating the program.

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp()
      Moves the selection in the menu up by one item. If the selection is at the first item, it wraps around to the last item.

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown()
      Moves the selection in the menu down by one item. If the selection is at the last item, it wraps around to the first item.
